RaceNotes: Edwards was the only name on the ballot.  See also the 1975 Louisiana Open Primary for Governor in which Edwards won a lanslide victory against Democratic opponents. No Republicans entered either race.

RaceTypeName: Primary Election Final (no General Election held)
RaceNotes: In Louisiana, any candidate who receives a majority is elected.  Since Edwards received a majority of the vote, no run-off general election was required.
There was no Democratic candidate for Governor on the ballot, Mark Fairchild being the "paired" Democrat for Lt. Governor.  The Democratic vote was cast for the ticket of "no name" and Fairchild.
In the absence of a majority for any candidate, the State Legislature elected Madeleine M. Kunin to a  two-year term.

RaceTypeName: Primary Election Final (no General Election held)
RaceNotes: Incumbent Governor Edwin W. Edwards withdrew after running second in the primary and no run-off general election was required.; The other vote was: Tauzin, W. J. (Democrat) 154,079
Neither major-party candidate won an absolute majority in this November election; therefore a run-off election was held February 26, 1991.
In January 1989, Lt. Governor Robert J. Miller (D) became Governor on the resignation of Gov. Richard H. Bryan (D) following his election November 1988 to the U.S. Senate.
Neither major-party candidate won an absolute majority in the November election; therefore a run-off election was held February 26, 1991.
Lt. Governor Howard B. Dean (D) became Governor in August 1991 upon the death of Richard A. Snelling (R).
Results include a total of 7,936 absentee ballots cast for the party's initial gubernatorial candidate, Chet Blaylock, who died October 23, 1996.
Incumbent Agnus King, an Indipendent candidate received 246,772 votes (58.6% of the total vote) and won the election
The other vote was: Humphrey, Hubert H. III (Democrat Farmer-Labor) 587,060
